caption:
|| Blue Light || 
 
@mblinch's Top Pictures of the 2016-17 Season 
 
"Another remote control image, the image was fired with radios from my shooting position on the floor. Before every game, spotlights fly around as they introduce the team. I love the shadows and light that gets cast over players and this is a great example." - @mblinch  
 
See the whole series on MapleLeafs.com
caption_raw:
|| Blue Light ||⠀
⠀
@mblinch's Top Pictures of the 2016-17 Season⠀
⠀
"Another remote control image, the image was fired with radios from my shooting position on the floor. Before every game, spotlights fly around as they introduce the team. I love the shadows and light that gets cast over players and this is a great example." - @mblinch ⠀
⠀
See the whole series on MapleLeafs.com

caption:
|| Bright Lights, Goal City. || 
 
@mblinch's Top Pictures of the 2016-17 Season 
 
"During the outdoor game, we all have to shoot a little differently. In order to show that the game is outside, we have to shoot with the whole stadium in the background. Normally I would shoot this picture a lot tighter, but I love how you can see Marner celebrating with the night sky in the background." - @mblinch  
 
See the whole series on MapleLeafs.com
caption_raw:
|| Bright Lights, Goal City. ||⠀
⠀
@mblinch's Top Pictures of the 2016-17 Season⠀
⠀
"During the outdoor game, we all have to shoot a little differently. In order to show that the game is outside, we have to shoot with the whole stadium in the background. Normally I would shoot this picture a lot tighter, but I love how you can see Marner celebrating with the night sky in the background." - @mblinch ⠀
⠀
See the whole series on MapleLeafs.com

caption:
|| In The Zone || 
 
@mblinch's Top Pictures of the 2016-17 Season 
 
"This picture was taken with a remote camera, that was installed in the net. It was fired remotely from my shooting position. This is a picture I had hoped and prayed to get. I have watched Andersen skate back to the net like this before every period all season. I knew if the sky was just the right colour of blue, it would look great. I am lucky everything came together on this picture the way I had hoped all year." - @mblinch  
 
See the whole series on MapleLeafs.com
caption_raw:
|| In The Zone ||⠀
⠀
@mblinch's Top Pictures of the 2016-17 Season⠀
⠀
"This picture was taken with a remote camera, that was installed in the net. It was fired remotely from my shooting position. This is a picture I had hoped and prayed to get. I have watched Andersen skate back to the net like this before every period all season. I knew if the sky was just the right colour of blue, it would look great. I am lucky everything came together on this picture the way I had hoped all year." - @mblinch ⠀
⠀
See the whole series on MapleLeafs.com

caption:
|| Taking the Game Outside || 
 
@mblinch's Top Pictures of the 2016-17 Season 
 
"In shooting the outdoor game, we need to really highlight the fact the guys were outside! Finding an angle that allows for the sky to be shown, or any other elements, such as eye black, and toques, helped convey the outdoors and the unique environment. It's a special game obviously for that reason, but also when do we ever get to photograph hockey in daylight?" - @mblinch  
 
See the whole series on MapleLeafs.com

caption:
|| Hallowed Halls || 
 
@mblinch's Top Pictures of the 2016-17 Season 
  "Hockey pictures aren't just about what happens on the ice. Here Matt Martin is walking through the hallway going to the dressing room. I love the pot lighting in the hallway because it provides really cool mood as you can feel here. " - @mblinch

caption:
|| Boys in Blue || 
 
@mblinch's Top Pictures of the 2016-17 Season 
 
"Another picture was taken with a remote camera installed in the roof of the ACC. This time we positioned the camera with the purpose of capture the guys hitting the ice. Luckily, Marner and Matthews came out of the gate perfectly, under the blue pre-game blue light for the photo." - @mblinch  
 
See the whole series on MapleLeafs.com
caption_raw:
|| Boys in Blue ||⠀
⠀
@mblinch's Top Pictures of the 2016-17 Season⠀
⠀
"Another picture was taken with a remote camera installed in the roof of the ACC. This time we positioned the camera with the purpose of capture the guys hitting the ice. Luckily, Marner and Matthews came out of the gate perfectly, under the blue pre-game blue light for the photo." - @mblinch ⠀
⠀
See the whole series on MapleLeafs.com

High Flying⠀
⠀
@mblinch's Top Pictures of the 2016-17 Season⠀
⠀
"The thing about Nazem Kadri is you never know what you will see. He's a pretty intense player on the ice, always flying through the air, checking, and playing hard. Because of this, he's a great player to photograph and he shows a lot of emotion when he scores." - @mblinch

The View From Above

@mblinch's Top Pictures of the 2016-17 Season
⠀
"This picture was taken using an overhead remote camera. We install these cameras three hours prior to a game in the roof of the ACC by clamping it to a catwalk rail. The goal of shooting from this angle is to produce a nice graphical top-down view of the game and so you can see into the net when a goal is scored." - Mark Blinch

caption:
With a new owner, came a new name. The St. Pats played their final game on Feb. 16th, 1927 against the Detroit Cougars in Windsor, ON. The next day at Mutual Street Arena, the team played their first game with the Maple Leaf on their sweater.

Celebrate the St. Pats game and the sweater the Maple Leafs will wear TONIGHT.

caption:
The Leafs have once again partnered with @citizenwatchcanada to recognize a member of the community.

Yesterday, Graham McKelvie was presented with the Citizen Community MVP Award for October. Graham is an Active Living Supervisor for the Boys and Girls Clubs of Hamilton and oversees the Skate the Dream Program. The program gives children and youth who would not otherwise have an opportunity to learn and play the game of hockey. #TMLtalk

caption:
Check out Frederik Andersen's World Cup mask!   #TMLtalk 
#Repost from @davidofdaveart  
Frederik Andersen is getting ready for the World Cup with his new Team Europe mask . A classic creation which live and breath hockey and Europe and Denmark. It is a true storyteller mask, the closer you come the more details you will discover, and the mask transforms in front of your eyes into a storybook filled with chapters of action....!  And check out, Frederik's Danish buddy shows up on the mask, a true tribute to his homecountry of Denmark  Thanks Fredrik! I love to be your personal artist  @frederikandersen31 @mapleleafs #DaveArt #nhl #DaveArtCreativity @nhl #wch2016
caption_raw:
Check out Frederik Andersen's World Cup mask! 🇩🇰 #TMLtalk 
#Repost from @davidofdaveart ・・・
Frederik Andersen is getting ready for the World Cup with his new Team Europe mask💪🏻🇩🇰. A classic creation which live and breath hockey and Europe and Denmark. It is a true storyteller mask, the closer you come the more details you will discover, and the mask transforms in front of your eyes into a storybook filled with chapters of action....!👊🏻🎨 And check out, Frederik's Danish buddy shows up on the mask, a true tribute to his homecountry of Denmark🇩🇰👍🏻 Thanks Fredrik! I love to be your personal artist😊 @frederikandersen31 @mapleleafs #DaveArt #nhl #DaveArtCreativity @nhl #wch2016

Give it a shot and let me know your score! I hope someone beats me so the standard gets raised for the next time I try this!! #rowbabyrow

caption:
#Repost from @brookslaich  
Handstand walks are a great way to build stability in the shoulders, upper back, and core! The added strength in these areas will translate to a better shot on the ice, as well as prepare your body to give and receive body checks for an @nhl season! It is vital to train for elite performance as well as injury prevention! Give this a try, and shoot me your videos!!
caption_raw:
😮
#Repost from @brookslaich ・・・
Handstand walks are a great way to build stability in the shoulders, upper back, and core! The added strength in these areas will translate to a better shot on the ice, as well as prepare your body to give and receive body checks for an @nhl season! It is vital to train for elite performance as well as injury prevention! Give this a try, and shoot me your videos!! 🙌

caption: Lou Lamoriello was named General Manager of the Toronto Maple Leafs on July 23, 2015. Learn about his many accolades and Hall of Fame career below.
caption_raw: Lou Lamoriello was named General Manager of the Toronto Maple Leafs on July 23, 2015. Learn about his many accolades and Hall of Fame career below.

caption: Lamoriello was the architect of the United States' gold medal winning team at the 1996 World Cup of Hockey. Team USA defeated Canada by a 5-2 score in the championship game to earn Lamoriello a World Cup gold medal just one year after he captured his first Stanley Cup.
caption_raw: Lamoriello was the architect of the United States' gold medal winning team at the 1996 World Cup of Hockey. Team USA defeated Canada by a 5-2 score in the championship game to earn Lamoriello a World Cup gold medal just one year after he captured his first Stanley Cup.

caption: Lamoriello was hired as President of the New Jersey Devils on April 27, 1987. He named himself General Manager of the Devils on September 10, 1987 and held that post until May 4, 2015 when he retired from the position. With 28 years at the helm, he is the longest serving GM in NHL history.
caption_raw: Lamoriello was hired as President of the New Jersey Devils on April 27, 1987. He named himself General Manager of the Devils on September 10, 1987 and held that post until May 4, 2015 when he retired from the position. With 28 years at the helm, he is the longest serving GM in NHL history.

caption: Lamoriello's teams made the playoffs in 13 consecutive seasons from 1996-97 to 2009-10. New Jersey went to the 2012 Stanley Cup final one year after missing the postseason for the first time in 14 tries in 2010-11.
caption_raw: Lamoriello's teams made the playoffs in 13 consecutive seasons from 1996-97 to 2009-10. New Jersey went to the 2012 Stanley Cup final one year after missing the postseason for the first time in 14 tries in 2010-11.

caption: Lamoriello's Devils captured nine division titles in his time as GM in 1996 97, 1997 98, 1998 99, 2000 01, 2002 03, 2005 06, 2006 07, 2008 09 and 2009 10.
caption_raw: Lamoriello's Devils captured nine division titles in his time as GM in 1996–97, 1997–98, 1998–99, 2000–01, 2002–03, 2005–06, 2006–07, 2008–09 and 2009–10.

caption: The New Jersey Devils captured the Prince of Wales trophy as Eastern Conference champions on five occasions (1995, 2000, 2001, 2003, 2012) with Lamoriello at the helm.
caption_raw: The New Jersey Devils captured the Prince of Wales trophy as Eastern Conference champions on five occasions (1995, 2000, 2001, 2003, 2012) with Lamoriello at the helm.

caption: Lamoriello won three Stanley Cups as General Manager of the New Jersey Devils. In 1995, the Devils swept the Detroit Red Wings. In 2000, they defeated the Dallas Stars in six games. In 2003, they defeated the Anaheim Mighty Ducks in seven games. They were defeated by the Colorado Avalanche and Los Angeles Kings in their other two Stanley Cup final appearances.
caption_raw: Lamoriello won three Stanley Cups as General Manager of the New Jersey Devils. In 1995, the Devils swept the Detroit Red Wings. In 2000, they defeated the Dallas Stars in six games. In 2003, they defeated the Anaheim Mighty Ducks in seven games. They were defeated by the Colorado Avalanche and Los Angeles Kings in their other two Stanley Cup final appearances.

caption: In 2009, Lamoriello was inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame in the Builders category.
caption_raw: In 2009, Lamoriello was inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame in the Builders category.

caption: In 2012, Lamoriello was inducted into the US Hockey Hall of Fame after serving as General Manager of Team USA's 1996 World Cup team and 1998 Olympic team.
caption_raw: In 2012, Lamoriello was inducted into the US Hockey Hall of Fame after serving as General Manager of Team USA's 1996 World Cup team and 1998 Olympic team.

Hence, I Am Able 340.
#TMLtalk

caption: Tap our username to learn more about Mike Babcock and his accomplishments
caption_raw: Tap our username to learn more about Mike Babcock and his accomplishments

caption: As head coach of Red Deer College, Babcock won the Alberta College championship in 1989 and he was named coach of the year.
caption_raw: As head coach of Red Deer College, Babcock won the Alberta College championship in 1989 and he was named coach of the year.

caption: As head coach of the University of Lethbridge Pronghorns, Babcock led the team to the CIS University Cup and was named CIS coach of the year.
caption_raw: As head coach of the University of Lethbridge Pronghorns, Babcock led the team to the CIS University Cup and was named CIS coach of the year.

caption: Babcock earned coach of the year honours in 1996 and 2000 behind the bench of the Spokane Chiefs of the Western Hockey League. He led his team to first place in the Western Division and into the WHL Finals.
caption_raw: Babcock earned coach of the year honours in 1996 and 2000 behind the bench of the Spokane Chiefs of the Western Hockey League. He led his team to first place in the Western Division and into the WHL Finals.

caption: Babcock's team Canada squad went 7-1-1 and defeated Sweden to win the gold medal. With the medal he became the first coach to lead Canada to both World Junior and the World Championship gold.
caption_raw: Babcock's team Canada squad went 7-1-1 and defeated Sweden to win the gold medal. With the medal he became the first coach to lead Canada to both World Junior and the World Championship gold.

caption: Babcock led Anaheim to their best season in franchise history in 2002-03 and coached the Mighty Ducks to Game 7 of the Stanley Cup Final. He also coached the Red Wings to the Western Conference championship and a second straight berth in the Stanley Cup Final.
caption_raw: Babcock led Anaheim to their best season in franchise history in 2002-03 and coached the Mighty Ducks to Game 7 of the Stanley Cup Final. He also coached the Red Wings to the Western Conference championship and a second straight berth in the Stanley Cup Final.

caption: Babcock coached the Red Wings to the 11th Stanley Cup in franchise history. They defeated the Pittsburgh Penguins in six games in the Stanley Cup Final.
caption_raw: Babcock coached the Red Wings to the 11th Stanley Cup in franchise history. They defeated the Pittsburgh Penguins in six games in the Stanley Cup Final.

caption: Babcock led Canada to the gold medal at the Vancouver Olympics, taking a 3-2 overtime victory against the United States in the championship game. With the medal, Babcock became the only coach to join the Triple Gold Club; members have won a Stanley Cup, an Olympic gold medal and a World Championship.
caption_raw: Babcock led Canada to the gold medal at the Vancouver Olympics, taking a 3-2 overtime victory against the United States in the championship game. With the medal, Babcock became the only coach to join the Triple Gold Club; members have won a Stanley Cup, an Olympic gold medal and a World Championship.

caption: Babcock went behind the bench once again for Canada and coached them to the gold medal at the Sochi Olympics. His team allowed three goals while going 6-0 and defeating Sweden in the championship game.
caption_raw: Babcock went behind the bench once again for Canada and coached them to the gold medal at the Sochi Olympics. His team allowed three goals while going 6-0 and defeating Sweden in the championship game.
